required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Brain Activity Changes After a Behavior Change Weight Loss Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Brain Activity Changes After a Behavior Change Weight Loss Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare brain changes in individuals with overweight or obesity enrolled in either the Noom Healthy Weight program or a matched control. The study objectives (primary and secondary) are to measure brain change reported as ERP and EEG data over a 16-week timeframe. Additionally, we will explore changes in the default mode network (resting-state asymmetry in EEG measurements), changes in executive functioning, quality of life, mood, and salivary markers as they relate to EEG data.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Flanker task performance: Intervention vs control
primary_outcome.description: Change in amplitude and latency in conflict monitoring stage at 16 weeks
Change from baseline Flanker task performance at 16 weeks
Change from baseline n-back task performance at 16 weeks
Change from baseline Stroop test at 16 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EEG data: Successful intervention (5% weight loss) in higher engagement subgroup (successful program completers) vs control
secondary_outcome.description: Task-specific event-related potential (ERP) peak amplitude and latency for channels and Task-specific event-related potential (ERP) peak amplitude and latency for channels and cortical ROIs Event-related spectral perturbation (time x frequency power) for channels and cortical ROIs Mean and relative power spectral density measures for each frequency band + select ratios, for channels and cortical ROIs Brain connectivity between cortical ROIs

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of EEG data in program starters to successful program completers
secondary_outcome.description: Task-specific event-related potential (ERP) peak amplitude and latency for channels and cortical ROIs Event-related spectral perturbation (time x frequency power) for channels and cortical ROIs Mean and relative power spectral density measures for each frequency band + select ratios, for channels and cortical ROIs Brain connectivity between cortical ROIs

Task-specific event-related potential (ERP) peak amplitude and latency for channels and cortical ROIs Event-related spectral perturbation (time x frequency power) for channels and cortical ROIs Mean and relative power spectral density measures for each frequency band + select ratios, for channels and cortical ROIs Brain connectivity between cortical ROIs

other_outcome.measure: Change in Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS-SF)
other_outcome.description: Explore measure as it relates to change in EEG data

other_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life outcome measure scoring (PROMIS-29)
other_outcome.description: Explore measure as it relates to change in EEG data

other_outcome.measure: Change in eating behavior measure scoring (Three-Factor Eating Questionnaire)
other_outcome.description: Explore measure as it relates to change in EEG data

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline salivary stress marker at 16 weeks
Change from baseline salivary tumor necrosis factor alpha at 16 weeks
Change from baseline salivary interleukin-6 at 16 weeks
Change from baseline blood pressure (systolic/diastolic) at 16 weeks

arm_group.description: Matched control group (Noom-branded 'healthy eating' short guide on weight loss).

intervention.intervention_name: Noom Healthy Weight; mobile behavior change program for weight loss.
intervention.description: The mobile cognitive behavior change program follows guidelines from the Obesity Society's "2013 Guidelines for the Management of Overweight and Obesity in Adults" NIH "Practical Guide on the Identification, Evaluation, and Treatment of Overweight and Obesity in Adults". There are 52 weeks of curriculum with 1-3 articles to read per day. Users are requested to perform weight logging once daily and food logging after each meal. Users are assigned human coaches and are able to interact with them via in-app messaging or phone communication. Users are also assigned to support groups via in-app messaging.
Matched control group (Noom-branded 'healthy eating' short guide on weight loss).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Each subject must be able to understand and provide informed consent
- Between the ages 18-60 years
- Self-report of good health
- Overweight or obesity (BMI â‰¥ 25)
- Able to meet our criteria of adherence to the program
- Able to attend in-person visit in Long Island, NY
Exclusion criteria:
- Inability or unwillingness to give written informed consent or comply with the study
- Visual impairment that cannot be corrected with glasses or contact lenses
- Any indication of drug, alcohol or medicine abuse.
- Presence of a condition or abnormality that in the opinion of the Investigator would compromise the safety of the patient or the quality of the data
- Presence of a brain injury, psychiatric disorders, seizure disorders, and other neurological conditions
- Reported eating disorder
- Currently pregnant or 6 months postpartum
- Planning to become pregnant within the next 5 months

clinical_study.keyword: EEG, mhealth, weight loss, CBT, cognitive behavior therapy
